page.title: 13Dwellings in Slitting Mill
page.content: {Fair Oak House:} This house was built for the manager of Fair Oak Colliery which closed down about 100 years ago. It is now divided into flats. {The Mission:}Standing in the grounds of Fair Oak House is a small mission church which was used by the miners and their families. Now it is converted into a quaint private dwelling. {Miners' Cottages:} You can see at Sheepwash, Forge Row, Lady Hill Terrace and Horn's Terrace, rows of terraced houses whose front doors open on to Slitting Mill Road. These homes were built to house the miners from Fair Oak Colliery last century. {Stonehouse:} This large house was built originally in the 16th Century and subsequently enlarged. It was the home of the iron masters of the area.
